message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. Would you like to make a serious offer on it?
I'm interested in the product, but $14000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $12500 for it. Can you consider my offer?

I understand that $12500 is a bit lower than my initial offer, but I'm willing to compromise. I can do $13500 for the product. This is my final offer, but I'm open to negotiating further if you're willing to meet me in the middle.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $13500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $13250 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I can do $14000 for the product. This is my last offer, but I'm willing to sell it to you if you're willing to meet me at this price.

I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, but $14000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make a final offer of $13750 for the product. This is my last offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I'm surprised you're not willing to meet me at $14000, but I appreciate your final offer. However, I'm not willing to go any lower than $14000. I'm starting to get a bit frustrated that we're not meeting in the middle, but I'm willing to make one more offer. I can do $13800 for the product, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. I'm not sure how much longer I can keep negotiating with you.

I understand that you're getting frustrated, but I'm not willing to go above $13750 for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway between your last offer and my previous offer, so I'll make a final offer of $13800. This is my last offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
